bug.short_desc: Splitpane adds widgets in a confusing way

long_desc.thetext:
You can add more than two widgets to the split pane, the pane cares only about children of index 2 and 3 but the layout determines the widget in index 2 as first widget and the absolute last added widget as second. This causes in a problem: e.g. The pane will care about widget 2 and 3 but the layout is rendering 2 and 4 (if added three widgets)
as can be seen here http://tinyurl.com/psq4opw
I would expect the pane has always two widgets, a call of add() causes in a rotation of widgets from right to left respectively bottom to top.
Further more I would love to be able to set widgets on a given position first (left/top) and second (right/bottom)
We can use protected _addAt() method but an public one would be helpfull especially because the offset for widgets is 2 (child control splitter and slider are previously added)
as can be seen here http://tinyurl.com/oajq6on

From my point of view this bug can be split up into two.
1. Make sure the "add" method is causing a exception in debug mode whenever more than two widgets are added.
2. Provide a API to easily add a widget at a defined position, e.g. removing the left widget and adding a new widget at this left position with one API call.
I guess this would be easier to understand and it won't be necessary to add some magic concerning the rotating of the widgets.
